title: Sri Lanka economy may contract 6.9-pct in 2022 PM says after soft-peg collapse
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka’s economy may contract as much as 6.9 percent in 2022 Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said as the country is hit by the worst currency crises triggered by the island’s 72-year old intermediate regime central bank.
“The central bank estimates the economy to contract about 4-5 percent in 2022,” Prime Minister Wickremesinghe told parliament on June 07.
“The IMF (International Monetary Fund) projections are worse. They think the economy may contract 6.9 percent.”
Sri Lanka’s rupee collapsed from 200 to 360 to the US dollars in a botched attempt to shift from a peg to a float with surrender requirement and low policy rates.
Rates were hiked in April to slow credit and economic activities but monetary stability is continuing with persistent forex shortages.  (COLOMBO/June07/2022 – Corrected 2022)
